content: परोक्ष {%<ab>a.</ab>%} {@--1@} Out of or beyond the range of sight, invisible, escaping observation. {@--2@} Absent; स्थाने वृता भूपतिभिः परोक्षैः <ls>R. 7. 13.</ls> {@--3@} Secret, unknown, stranger; परोक्षमन्मथो जनः <ls>Ś. 2. 18</ls> ‘a stranger to the influence of love’; <ls>H. Pr. 10.</ls> --क्षः An ascetic. --क्षं {@--1@} Absence, invisibility. {@--2@} (In <ab>gram.</ab>) Past time or tense (not witnessed by the speaker); परोक्षे लिट् <ls>P. III. 2. 115.</ls> {%Note%}. The <ab>acc.</ab> and <ab>loc.</ab> singulars of परोक्ष ({%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} परोक्षं, परोक्षे) are used adverbially in the sense of ‘in one's absence’, ‘out of sight’, ‘behind one's back’, with or without a <ab>gen.</ab>; परोक्षे खलीकर्तुं शक्यते न ममाग्रतः <ls>Mk. 2</ls>; परोक्षे कार्यहतारं प्रत्यक्षे प्रियवादिनं <ls>Chāṇ. 18</ls>; नोदाहरेदस्य नाम परोक्षमपि केवलं <ls>Ms. 2. 119.</ls>
